result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark R Schlechta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark R Schlechta is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark R Schlechta was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
BAIL OF $465.00 APPLIED. Balance of  Fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
BAIL APPLIED. Blood draw costs paid in full. To be forwarded to the Village of Hartland Police Dept.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Associated with Charge #4
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Mark R Schlechta in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 4.  Court finds defendant guilty. Cts. 1 and 2 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed by operation of law. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 4:
- 200 days jail straight time STAYED for 18 months Probation
- Fine totaling $1494.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation - apply bail  
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  
- Defendant to perform 75 hours of community service as a condition of probation.
- 50 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH - 20 days credit.  Non-working hours with standard release Conditions.  
- 30 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 30 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting has been complied with.
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Oconomowoc Memorial Hospital -  append to fine and to be paid as a condition of probation. 
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence forthwith
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
